text.0: taste this strong draught enriched with offered viands with all thy chariot here unyoke thy coursers.
text.1: let not those other sacrificers stay thee indra these juices shed for thee are ready.
text.2: thine is the juice effused thine are the juices yet to be pressed our resonant songs invite thee.
text.3: o indra pleased today with this libation come thou who knowest all and drink the soma.
text.4: whoso devoted to the god effuses soma for him with yearning heart and spirit.
text.5: never doth indra give away his cattle for him he makes the lovely soma famous.
text.6: he looks with ioving favour on the mortal who like a rich man pours for him the soma.
text.7: maghavan in his bended arm supports him he slays unasked the men who hate devotion.
text.8: we call on thee to come to us desirous of goods and spoil of cattle and of horses.
text.9: for thy new love and favour are we present let us invoke thee indra as our welfare.
